A simple tutorial for visualization of large, high-dimensional data

[2016-11-16]

I recently showed some examples of using Datashader for large scale visualization (post here), and the examples seemed to catch people’s attention at a workshop I attended earlier this week (Web of Science as a Research Dataset). Based on that interest, I’ve decided write up a little tutorial here to share with people. Hope it’s useful!

Fluctuations in musical genre popularity over time

[2016-09-14]

A question I’m beginning to explore is understanding how and when new musical genres emerge, and as an initial exploratory step I’ve been generating some visualizations of genre popularity over time using my data from Last.fm. Classifying the genre of a given song or artist is a tricky business (that I’ll hopefully have time to discuss later), but for now I’m using data I scraped from Gracenote, which classifies each song with a three-level genre hierarchy.

Read More

Modeling musical artists

[2016-05-09]

With just a few months to go until I (hopefully) finish grad school, I’ve finally started working on the stuff I’m really excited about, namely studying how people “forage” for music. There’s lots more to be said about this, and I hope it makes it into another post, but for now I have some fun visuals to share.

Redesigned Website

[2016-04-06]

For anyone who’s been here before, I’ve done a major overhaul of my site design, mainly to facilitate a simple blogging workflow with Jekyll, a markdown-based, static HTML blogging system. It’s built into Github pages, and let’s you handle all your authoring and updating via Git.

New beginnings (at NICO!)

[2016-04-05]

After far too long telling my self that I should start “blogging” (shudders), I’m finally convinced that keeping a written log of my activities (predominantly, though not exclusively, research-related) is probably a good idea. I have no illusions of nor strong desire for major readership, but my hope is that this will help me communicate my work to people who care, and more importantly help me clarify my own ideas as I get them on the page.
